snippet: A South Carolina man, identified as Timothy Ray Jones Jr., led the authorities on Tuesday to the bodies of his children in rural Alabama, ending a six-day search across the South.
abstract: Alabama law enforcement officials say South Carolina man Timothy Ray Jones Jr led them to bodies of his five children in rural Alabama, ending a six-day search that had stretched across the South; children, all 1 to 8 years old, were reported missing by their mother on Sept 3; Jones will be charged initially with unlawful neglect of a child by a legal custodian, though officials expected to file additional charges.
lead_paragraph: A South Carolina man, identified as Timothy Ray Jones Jr., led the authorities on Tuesday to the bodies of his children in rural Alabama, ending a six-day search across the South.

headline.main: 5 Children Found Dead in Alabama After Search
headline.print_headline: 5 Children Found Dead in Alabama After Search
